items.headline: Futures Indicate Cautious Open Amid Tech Selloff and Anticipated CPI Report
items.summary: US stock index futures are drifting lower in pre-market trading, reflecting a skittish market sentiment after a rout in technology stocks. Investors are keenly awaiting today's Consumer Price Index (CPI) report, a key economic data release expected to influence the Federal Reserve's monetary policy path. Global markets are also exhibiting weakness, with Asian indices trading lower.

items.headline: Zebra Technologies rallies over 15% in pre-market
items.summary: Zebra Technologies ($ZBRA) shows strong pre-market gains.

items.headline: WeShop Holdings surges over 80%
items.summary: WeShop Holdings ($WSHP) experiencing a significant jump in pre-market trading.

items.headline: Equinix Inc. sees pre-market rise
items.summary: Data center giant Equinix Inc. ($EQIX) trending upwards in early trading.

items.headline: Strata Skin Sciences plummets over 60%
items.summary: Strata Skin Sciences ($SSKN) leads pre-market losers with a sharp decline.

items.headline: American Rebel Holdings facing significant pre-market losses, potential delisting
items.summary: American Rebel Holdings ($AREB) is down sharply in pre-market, with trading expected to be suspended today due to non-compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price rule.

items.headline: Society Pass declines nearly 40% in early trading
items.summary: Society Pass ($SOPA) records substantial pre-market losses.

items.headline: US January CPI Report on Deck Today
items.summary: The highly anticipated US Consumer Price Index (CPI) report for January is scheduled for release today. Economists are forecasting a slowdown in the annual inflation rate to 2.5% for both headline and core CPI, compared to December's 2.7% and 2.6% respectively. This report is considered a 'marquee event' that could significantly influence the Federal Reserve's stance on interest rate cuts.

items.headline: AI Concerns Fuel Continued Tech Sector Selloff
items.summary: Concerns surrounding artificial intelligence-led disruptions are driving a sustained selloff in technology stocks globally. Indian benchmark indices saw significant declines, with the Nifty IT index particularly hard hit, indicating a broad-based negative sentiment toward the sector. Weak earnings from companies like Cisco Systems Inc. ($CSCO) further exacerbated the tech rout.

items.headline: Major Companies Announce Q3 Earnings
items.summary: Several prominent companies are slated to release their Q3 earnings reports today, February 13, 2026. Notable reports include Torrent Pharmaceuticals, GMR Airports, Siemens Energy India, Info Edge India, Alkem Laboratories, and Fortis Healthcare, among others. Investors will be closely watching these reports for insights into corporate performance amidst current market conditions.

items.headline: Gold and Silver Rebound Amid Risk-Off Mood
items.summary: Precious metals, including gold and silver, are experiencing a rebound in choppy trading as a risk-off sentiment prevails in the broader markets. This recovery follows a recent plunge, with investors seeking the perceived safety of these assets amidst equity market pressures.
